( Carnage: I regret to say that Penpals is not in order at the moment, so I 
am forced to use my Hotmail account again. Please be paitent if I fall 
behind. Thank you.)


* The sight of the enemy base disgusted him, a snarl on his fangs and his 
jaw clamped shut as a deep and low growl escaped his throat. Swearing that 
if any Alliance bot was within reach at that very moment there wouldn�t be 
anything left of them when he was through. But he secretly hoped that one 
would be stupid enough to bump into him, something to relieve his rage upon 
that was building up with each breath!
Dinobot crouched on a slight rise in the forest surrounding the Alliance 
base, close enough to get a fairly good view of the enemy ship but just far 
enough to remain out of scanners reach.
But knowing that for a fact that if he were only 5 feet more ahead of his 
current position he would then be scanable, though having no interest to 
give his position away.
Having been there for over a mega-cycle he had had plenty of time to think 
about the task ahead.
At this particular point he knew that communication through com-links was 
very dangerous, their signature and message being able to be scanned and 
located very easily at this range.
There was no sound, no movement save the wind rustling the branches of Pine 
and Fur above him. Closing his eyes for a moment and listening to the wind, 
it giving variations of the movement of strange things in which he might be 
concerned to be aware of. However, this day there was something else on the 
wind, something in which slightly calmed him but then sharpened his focus 
towards the task at hand.
Opening his eyes he then dug his claws into the needle covered floor, very 
aware that there was much to do in the near future and no real time to 
simply listen to variations of air.
Dinobot growled as he narrowed hie eyes and twitched his tail, knowing that 
he was ready for the peril that was right in front of him.
But it was then that he heard Prowl�s voice liven his com-link, snapping and 
cursing he rose and turned away from the enemy ship. Walking off a mile in 
order not to be detected, knowing that he should have switched off his 
device but then knowing that if something was to happen then he needed it 
open.
With a shake of his head and a sigh of annoyance he then sent his location 
to Prowl, coded and recoded as not to be detected by Alliance scanners.
Also along with his location was the coded message that as soon as Prowl 
received the coded transmission he was to then refrain from using the 
communicator any longer. The mission was far too dangerous to be buggered up 
by the simple need to use a traceable device.
Prowl and himself would then use verbal communication when he arrived at his 
position, and the more closer they came to the Alliance base the more they 
would rely on signals and such. For ones� voice was traceable as well.
Dinobot then turned towards the Alliance base again but now it was well out 
of view, Pine and Fur now dominated when he saw.
Now his only task was simple, and perhaps the last simple one he would have 
for the rest of the day, to simply wait while Prowl came to accompany him. *
